</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> System </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Load the given world, launch an empty mission and execute the given, expression. Config (optional) can reference to the config entry, replacing description.ext for this mission.  </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''playScriptedMission''' [world,expression,config,ignoreChildWindow] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> [world,expression,config,ignoreChildWindow]: [[Array]] -  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> world: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> expression: [[Code]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> config (Optional): [[Config]]</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER4</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> ignoreChildWindow (Optional): [[Boolean]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER5</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 


</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> 
<code>
playScriptedMission
[
	"desert_e",
	{
		private["_handle"];
		_handle = execVM "\ca\missions_e\data\scenes\credits1\init.sqf";
	},
	configFile/"CfgMissions"/"Cutscenes"/"Credits"
];
</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[hostMission]], [[playMission]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part></template>

[[Category:Scripting Commands Arma 3|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands Take On Helicopters|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 31, 2015 - 17:55 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:SkaceKachna|SkaceKachna]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
For this command to work, you will need to<br>
<ol>
<li>call command with ignoreChildWindow param set to true (in VBS docs its called fromMission)</li>
<li>close any opened display (not sure about this part, but closing every display (but #0) seems to work):<br>
If mission is run from 2D editor, you can just close RscDisplayArcadeMap display (idd 26) (because this was done from 2D editor, so RscDisplayArcadeMap is still active in background -- [[user:benargee|benargee]])</li>
If mission is run from single mission browser, you can just close RscDisplaySingleMission (idd 2)</li>
<li>end mission</li>
</ol>
Debriefing will show and player will be moved to new mission after clicking on Continue.<br><br>

Command is a bit bugged:
<ul>
<li>Third (config) param doesn't seem to work</li>
<li>If you run this command in mission loaded from pbo, said pbo won't be writable until you close the game (you can't update it)</li>
</ul><br>

Following code will change change island to Stratis and spawns player as basic soldier at [0,0,0] coordinates.
<code><ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>disableSerialization;
playScriptedMission ['Stratis',{
	createCenter west;
	_grp = createGroup west;
	_player = _grp createUnit ["B_Soldier_F",[0,0,0],[],0,"NONE"];
	selectPlayer _player;
},missionConfigFile, true];

//Close all displays that could be the background display ... this is essentialy forceEnd command
//Closing #0 will cause game to fail
_zero = findDisplay(0);
{
	if (_x != _zero) then {
		_x closeDisplay 1;
	};
} foreach allDisplays;

failMission "END1";</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext></code>
(tested in Arma 3 1.54.133741)
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
